Award.AwardTitle: REU Site: Collaborative Research: Undergraduate Research in Computational Data Analytics for Advancing Human Services

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration:
The worldwide production of data is exploding and traditional human service related fields such as education, public policy, healthcare, and environmental science are seeking ways to ask smarter questions, build more accurate data models, and drive more effective action. This Research Experience for Undergraduates (REU) site will engage undergraduate students in critical and timely research in data intensive computational science and its interdisciplinary applications. The site offers a collection of carefully planned undergraduate learning and research opportunities spanning a spectrum of human services, such as evidence-based smart health, data-empowered education, and data driven business intelligence. It seeks to encourage qualified students, particularly underrepresented minority students and women, to become excited about the immense potential of data analytics to impact societal outcomes, and to motivate them to include data science as part of their future studies and careers. The REU site will provide students from the New York-New Jersey metropolitan area with excellent research experiences bolstered by academic and social connections that support a collaborative team environment. The site students will live on New Jersey Institute of Technology's (NJIT) fully-wired 48 acre campus, which may well be a life-changing experience for a group of urban commuter students. The students' home schools will also benefit from the students' assigned task of connecting data science to their major fields of study, and sharing their research experiences with their fellow students. The students will also become members of a new learning community in data science, which will use social networking sites and periodic webinars to continue the summer's exploration of critical issues in the field as well as spotlight potential career opportunities. Finally, graduates of the REU site will have the potential to become future data science professionals who can impact society and enhance the quality of life through transforming human services.

The site combines New Jersey Institute of Technology's broad depth of expertise in computer science and high powered computing infrastructure with Hofstra University's outstanding programs in human services and business. Each summer ten talented students will work in small teams on carefully planned research experiences under the mentorship of expert faculty and graduate students. The students will choose from topics such as the study of environmental cancer risk, improving learning through automated assessment, designing intelligent on-line advertising, and constructing roadside sensors for driving safety. In addition to project-based research, the students will experience a rich variety of seminars, workshops, and industry visits for a broad spectrum of exciting career development opportunities. The students' in-depth personal engagement will enable them to gain a concrete understanding regarding key knowledge and skills in data science, as well as its main research methodologies. They will use descriptive and inferential statistics to draw conclusions from big data, understand the impact of model assumptions and selection on analysis outcomes, and look at the research process, including the literature review, design and implementation of research approaches, digital data collection and communicating research findings to a technical and non-technical audience. Ultimately, the students are achieving a deepening knowledge of the field of data science and its conceptual connections along with improved written and oral communication, critical thinking and problem solving skills. A major goal of the site is to open new studies and career tracks for talented underrepresented students to explore how data science can advance the impact of human services.

ProgramReference.Text: REU SITE-Res Exp for Ugrd Site

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Summer REU Site project is a three-year project designed to develop undergraduate students’ research experience under the mentorship of expert faculty and graduate students. The site combined the broad depth of expertise in computer science and high-powered computing infrastructure of New Jersey Institute of Technology with the outstanding programs in human services and business of Hofstra University. A major goal of the site was to open new studies and career tracks for talented underrepresented students to explore how data science can advance the impact of human services. The intended program outcomes are: development of students’ deepening knowledge of the field of data science and its conceptual connections along with improved written and oral communication, critical thinking and problem solving skills (short-term); improved student competence in data science and computational research (mid-term outcome), and increased student participation in graduate research and graduate programs in data analytics/IT (long-term outcome).

 

Program Summary

Goal and Objectives/Intended Outcomes

*A major goal of the site was to open new studies and career tracks for talented underrepresented students to explore how data science can advance the impact of human services.

 The objective/intended outcomes for the Project:

*Develop students’ deepening knowledge of the field of data science along with improved written and oral communication, critical thinking and problem solving skills.

*Improve student achievement in data science and computational research.

*Increase student participation in graduate research and graduate programs.

 

Major Activities 

All students were involved in activities designed to:

*Develop an intensive program that targets student in-depth knowledge and concrete understanding of key knowledge and skills in data science.

* Provide opportunities team-based research experiences under the mentorship of expert faculty and graduate students.

 *Support the conduct of project-based research designed to develop knowledge and practical application of research methodologies including the design and implementation of research approaches.

*Promote communication, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, and academic writing.

 

Program Content

All students participated in common core program activities that culminated with team project based on student interest. The content addressed key topics such as data analytics, literature review and research, health analytics, and academic writing; the applied activities and content included workshops, roundtable discussions, and collaborative research projects; the practical/real world aspect of the Program was implemented through company visits designed to develop students’ understanding of the industrial practice on data analytics.

 

Evaluation of Program Long-term Project Benefits and Impact

Project benefits and impact

The REU Site program comprised rigorous content presented through a variety of presentations, activities, roundtable discussions, and interactions that introduced students to new content knowledge, deepened their existing knowledge, engaged them in the research process, and increased their knowledge of and interest in graduate studies and professional careers in data analytics. All the respondents overwhelmingly indicated that the Project had a very positive or positive impact on their academic and career goals with key skills learned in all seven main areas: research, communication, critical thinking, problem-solving, self-regulated learning team-work/collaboration, and academic writing. The overall design and implementation of the program yielded some key positive benefits to all students: It afforded undergraduate students from underserved and minority communities (and more specifically, women) the opportunities to (a) receive exposure to a more rigorous and specialized area of interest, (b) enhance their academic knowledge and skills, (c) understand the research process by developing and applying research skills, (d) learn from experts in the field, and (e) establish a foundation for these students’ future graduate studies, internship opportunities, and professional careers.

 

Conclusion

The REU Site program has made great progress in achieving its goals and objectives/learning outcomes and consequently, has had a very positive impact on students. The explicit focus on recruiting underserved students for the program, and subsequently improving their knowledge of and achievement in data science and computational research, have resulted in their positive views of the field, and has led to a strong impact on students’ academic and career path by directly influencing their future academic (graduate school) and/or career paths in data analytics through their active and ongoing participation in research, internships, and careers in the field.
